stories.text:
Hello all,

In late Feb I launched my first SaaS Leansence.

It was quite comprehensive when it came to features. It was an end-to-end digital presence platform. From social media automation tools, to blogging CMS, to website builders.

However, I quickly realized I was trying to target a very broad range of users and I just couldn't maintain all these features in the long term, not to mention I didn't have any users.

My apps main unique selling point was the cross posting feature that drove me to build Leansence.

Eventually after about 2 months of marketing, I decided to strip away 80% of the features in a weeks time and the result was my new SaaS Wildfire.

I already have over 10 free and one paying user and its just little over a month since launch.

It's lighter, faster and simpler and free to get started, no credit card required.

With Wildfire, you can easily increase your blog views by cross posting your blog to Hashnode, Medium, DEV, Reddit and Twitter.

With Wildfire, you can import your blogs using RSS feeds, markdown, html files or even by posting a link of your Hashnode and DEV blog, after which in just 2-3 clicks you can cross post it to 5 platforms.

AI content generation is in the works right now.

Any feedback would be appreciated.
stories.title: Show HN: I recreated my SaaS that took me 6 months to build in just 1 week

stories.text:
Innovation needs no-code!

The first version of our no-code automation platform, Do10X, with an open-source engine, will be ready very soon.

With Do10X, you can affordably build automations for yourself (personal, business, or any other reasons), or you can build a no-code SaaS with your automations.

Imagine building a SaaS was as easy as creating an automation on Zapier (you haven't tried Do10x yet ;) )

Imagine all the business ideas you can now implement with minimum effort...

We'll have an announcement for limited initial customers, and the rough estimate of pricing for these users will be around $15 USD per 100K task executions!

Stay tuned for the updates.

https://github.com/dotenx/dotenx
stories.title: No-code automation or SaaS factory
